task.title: Configuring the base size device for tenant data storage

context.p: Use this procedure to configure the base size of virtual storage devices for tenants in the application data thin pool. The base size is used each time a tenant device is created. In particular, the first time serviced starts, it creates the base size device and then creates a tenant device from the base size device.
The following configuration variable is used to specify the base size device:

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Identify the size of the thin pool for application data.
step.info: The size is required to set an accurate value for the SERVICED_DM_BASESIZE variable.

step.cmd: Edit storage variables in the configuration file.

substep.cmd: Add SERVICED_DM_BASESIZE immediately after SERVICED_DM_THINPOOLDEV, and set its value.

stepxmp.p: Replace Fifty-Percent with the value that is less than or equal to 50% of the size of the thin pool for application data. Include the symbol for gigabytes, G:
